channel.title: Protect your computer!
channel.description:
[center][size=13pt][b]Protect your computer!![/b][/size][/center]
*Introduction *Software *Definitions [left][u][b] Introduction[/b][/u][/left]
I have wanted to contribute something to you, moparisthebest community (everyone), it is a software that will keep your computer safe. Now I can as I have some spare time today! The software I wanted to provide you with is called ZoneAlarm. ZoneAlarm is acclaimed to be the best firewall software available. The versions that I am providing you with usually cost $39.95-$49.99, but now it is free!
We all hate getting viruses, spyware, adware, malicious (harmful) files, and more onto our computers! You don't have to worry about protecting your computer anymore. This software will automatically do it for you. Are you afraid of going to sites that automatically download trojans, or viruses onto your computer? ZoneAlarm will immediately block that site, and prevent anything from being downloaded. Don't hesitate to download a file, Zonealarm will check that file upon download, and if it's found harmful, the file will be deleted before it can install itself.
I have used ZoneAlarm, and recommend that everyone should use it. It has protected my computer numerous times. This firewall comes with a lifetime of updates! It will notify you if there is a newer version of the software available. You won't ever need to find another firewall. It also contains a virus scanner, and a spyware scanner. I suggest that you keep your own virus scanner, and spyware scanner because the built-in ZoneAlarm virus and spyware scanner takes a lot of ram when it is being used. ZoneAlarm, however, doesn't take that much space compared to firewalls made by other companies. It is less than 35mb.
It is really easy to install this software. All you do is have to download it from the links below, extract it, and then click on the setup file, Zone Alarm Pro or Suite, depending on which one you downloaded. (In order to extract it, you need winrar, or any other archiver that can extract .rar files.) After you run the setup it will configure everything, and might have some options fro you to choose from. [u][b] Software[/b][/u] - Click on the name to download.
[b]This password is required when you are extracting the file. The password is [u][glow=red,2,300]here[/glow][/u].[/b]
[img]http://img91.imageshack.us/img91/7871/untitleddv6.jpg[/img]
[url=http://www.uploading.com/files/QYNFX0O7/ZoneAlarm_Suite.rar.html]ZoneAlarm Suite[/url] The Most Complete Internet Security Solution
State-of-the-art, multi-layered protection offers the most robust security available for your PC by preventing attacks before they occur. Includes operating system firewall, network and program firewall, antivirus, anti-spyware, identity theft protection, game mode, IM protection, parental control, and much more.
[url=http://www.uploading.com/files/UHWDABKJ/ZoneAlarm_Pro.rar.html]ZoneAlarm Pro[/url] Advanced firewall with identity and privacy protection
Add powerful, multi-layered security to your current antivirus for more protection. Includes anti-spyware, operating system firewall, network and program firewall, identity theft protection, game mode, and much more.
[u][b]Definitions[/b][/u]
[b]Firewall[/b]: Any of a number of security schemes that prevent unauthorized users from gaining access to a computer network or that monitor transfers of information to and from the network.
[b]Virus[/b]: A computer program that is designed to replicate itself by copying itself into the other programs stored in a computer. It may be benign or have a negative effect, such as causing a program to operate incorrectly or corrupting a computer's memory.
[b]Spyware[/b]: Software that sends information about your Web surfing habits to its Web site. Often quickly installed in your computer in combination with a free download you selected from the Web, spyware transmits information in the background as you move around the Web. Also known as "parasite software," "scumware," "junkware" and "thiefware," spyware is occasionally installed just by visiting a Web site
[b]Adware[/b]: Software that periodically pops up advertisements on a user's computer. It displays ads targeted to the individual user based on key words entered in search engines and the types of Web sites the user visits. The marketing data is collected periodically and sent in the background to the adware Web server. Adware is known as "contextual marketing."
Enjoy!
Your friend, Leader

item.description:
@leader wrote:

Suite key:0gh29-vm1q9-exktm-90b4ad-th7gg0
Pro key:jcv81-dtiev-2g7sq-bmfn2g-5dbwq0

Sorry about the keygen, I don’t have one. I never included one in there, I just included some keys.

Read full topic

item.description:

you included the file for the keygen but it says to unpack and install it but… theres nothing to install theres no keygen…

item.title: Protect your computer!
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

It has two processes running for me. The client, and the on-demand antivirus scanner.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 23, 2006, 12:16:14 AM[/size][hr]I put the System Mechanic 6 Pro 6 on my computer. The System Mechanic takes 37k Memory Usage on my computer that is without including the virus scanner. That is way more than ZoneAlarm does, for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Protect your computer!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

That’s pretty good.

We have ZA on my dad’s comp, and it has about a total of 5 or 6 extra processes, but he has 26-28 processes running. (Kasperksy only has 3 running )

Read full topic

item.title: Protect your computer!
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

Using the laptop I have 29 processes and the total commit charge is 201 M / 1228 M. On the desktop I have 20 processes and the commit charge is 137 M / 1228 M.

It also depends on which ZoneAlarm version you use. The Suite version which I use takes more than the Pro version.

Your friend,
Leader

Added the Suite version of ZoneAlarm.

Read full topic

item.title: Protect your computer!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

leader:

No problem. ZoneAlarm doesn’t have that much charge for me. It only does when I run the virus scan and spyware scan.

When not running any scans…

How many processes do you have running? Total commit charge?

I’m running 23 processes and my total commit charge is 187 M / 1227 M. Including Firefox, and 2 instances of scar.exe.

If you can beat that, then I will agree that ZoneAlarm is better.

Read full topic

item.title: Protect your computer!
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

No problem. ZoneAlarm doesn’t have that much charge for me. It only does when I run the virus scan and spyware scan.

item.title: Protect your computer!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:5, topic:15430”][quote author=thealmighty link=topic=22988.msg259834#msg259834 date=1158799411]
pfft said sumthin about bad header and the password is here??weird anyway ty ron
System Mechanic Pro 6 with Kaspersky Firewall is the l33test of them all ==]

EDIT:REP++

[/quote]

Bad header? I meant that you type in “here” when it says enter password for the encrypted file. This thread was only supposed to be for ZoneAlarm software. :([/quote]

Sorry leader. I removed the link to system mecanic and added it to my thread where that belongs lol.

PS: ZoneAlarm reaks lol, Kaspersky is the best firewall now. ZoneAlarm, Norton, McAfee, and BlackIce are such resource hogs. Kaspersky takes up like… 15k commit charge where as the other ones take up about 70 or up to 100k. That’s why I posted the link to system mechanic.

Read full topic
